none.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not any amount of something or not one of a group of people or things
none.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I wish I could offer you some cake but there’s none left.
Although these were good students, none had a score above 60.
She waited for a reply, but none came.
Even an old car is better than none.
‘Was there any mail?’ ‘No, none at all.’
Despite her illness, she had lost none of her enthusiasm for life.
I know what people are saying – but none of it is true.
None of my friends phones me anymore.
none.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: Don’t use another negative word such as ‘not’ with none You say
We got 3 points and they got none
We got 3 points and they didn’t get none
none.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1]: We got 3 points and they didn’t get any
none.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2]: You use none of  before a plural noun or pronoun and a singular verb
None of us is able to escape the consequences of our actions
none.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3]: In informal English, people often use a plural verb after none of
None of us care what happens to him
none.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: USAGE: None, neither
none.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: You use none  to talk about a group of three or more things or people
none.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: You use neither to talk about two things or people
Neither of my parents wanted me to go
